Sgurr Choinnich

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Sgurr Choinnich is nearly always ascended together with its higher neighbour Sgurr a' Chaorachain. Sgurr Choinnich may be lower but it is the finer peak of the pair, with plenty of crags buttressing its elegant summit ridge.

 You have not climbed Sgurr Choinnich.

Region: Torridon

Altitude: 999 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.41/5
Rating: 3.4/5 (44 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Sgurr a' Chaorachain and Sgurr Choinnich from Achnashellach

Other routes and challenges

The approach via the Allt a' Chaonais given above is almost invariably used.

The extremely fit could combine the Walkhighlands route with the additional Munro of Maoile Lunndaidh, or with the Corbetts Sgurr nan Feartaig and Beinn Tharsuinn.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Lochcarron Hotels

Lochcarron B&B

Lochcarron Cottages

Torridon Hostels

There are 1996 Walkhighlanders who have climbed Sgurr Choinnich. They have contributed 51 public walk reports including this summit. These are ordered below with the most popular ones first. The rightmost column shows how many summits were included in their report, which may help you to find the most relevant reports.
